summary: How does Medicare ensure that hospitals, physicians, and others are providing high-quality health care? Medicare can adjust payments based on performance, but it also keeps providers accountable by making health care quality information publicly available. Medicare has made it a priority to develop and use measures of health care quality that address key aspects of care while minimizing the data reporting burden on providers. However...
title: Health Care Quality: CMS Could More Effectively Ensure Its Quality Measurement Activities Promote Its Objectives
